title: Expert recommendation and auto-assignment for ticket handling
content:
Agents are often looking for the best expert to assist with a specific issue. For example, identifying the best agent for a request/incident assignment. 
The Expert recommendation and auto assignment for ticket handling feature opens the possibility to show the relevant experts when you view the request/incident details.

Expert recommendation for ticket handling

To benefit from this feature, you need to edit the following settings:

Enable expert recommendation

  1. Log in as a tenant admin.
  2. From the main menu, select Administration > Configuration > Application Settings.
  3. Make sure the Enable expert recommendation for ticket handling option is set to On, and click Save in the upper left corner.
    You may also turn on Enable the “Call in Teams” action in the expert recommendation widget to display the “Call in Teams” option when you view the recommended experts in request/incident details.

Add expertise skills

You can add expertise skills by one of the following methods.

Method 1: Add expertise skills from Hot Topic Analytics

Administrators can add hot topics as agent users' expertise skills from Hot Topic Analytics.

  1. Log in to the suite as a tenant admin.
    • For requests: Go to Build > Knowledge > Hot Topic Analytics > Requests.
    • For incidents: Go to Run > Problem > Hot Topic Analytics > Incident.
  2. Select one topic in the map.
    Note: The + Expertise button will be disabled when multiple topics are selected.
  3. Select the relevant requests/incidents as required.
  4. Click the + Expertise button. The system will only process requests/incidents that have values in the OwnedByPerson and ExpertAssignee fields, then the owners and expert assignees of the requests/incidents will be listed in the window. 
  5. Select the users to whom you want to add this topic as their expertise skills.
  6. Click OK.

Note: You can select up to 10 experts at a time.

Method 2: Add expertise skills from the Person page

Administrators can add agent users' expertise skills from the Person page.

  1. Log in to the suite as a tenant admin.
  2. Go to Administration > Master Data > People > People.
  3. Click the person record in the ID column.
  4. In the Responsibilities tab, add the expertise skills in the Area of expertise section.

Method 3: Add expertise skills from the user profile

Agent users can also add expertise skills from the user profile by themselves.

  1. Log in to the suite as an agent user.
  2. Click the user name or avatar in the upper right corner and then select User profile to open the Profile & Preferences page.
  3. Add your expertise skills in the Area of expertise field.

View expert recommendation

When you view the request/incident details, the system will recommend relevant experts based on the expertise skills information.

Displayed in the Experts widget

  1. Log in to the suite as an agent user.
  2. Create a new request/incident or open an existing request/incident to view details.
    Make sure that the title and description fields are filled with some keywords for this request/incident.
  3. In the right pane, the Experts widget displays the recommended users with relevant expertise skills. Please be aware that there may be a delay in viewing recommended users after adding expertise skills, as the system will automatically initiate the process of indexing new content, which typically takes around 10 minutes.
    Note: Up to 10 experts at the top relevant will be recommended.
    When you hover over an expert from the list, you can:
    • View the details of the Person record
    • Send emails to the user
    • Chat with the user 
    • Add the user as Expert assignee of this request/incident
      Note: Be sure to save the changes after you add the user as Expert assignee of the request/incident.
    • Add the user to Major incident team (for incidents only)
    • Add the user as a follower to the request (for requests only)
    • Call the user in Teams
      Note: This option is available when Enable the “Call in Teams” action in the expert recommendation widget is set to On in the Application Settings.

Displayed in the Entity Picker

  1. Log in to the suite as an agent user.
  2. Create a new request/incident or open an existing request/incident to view details.
    Make sure that the title and description fields are filled with some keywords for this request/incident.
  3. On the General tab page, go to the Assignment section. 
  4. Go to Studio > Processes and Rules > Rendering forms, locate the rule named as "Get experts suggested by smart analytics for expert field with header title based on content fields". For the header parameter, enter the text to be displayed in the user interface. Example:
  5. In the drop-down list of Expert assignee field, the suggested experts will appear at the top of the list under the header (for example, Experts) based on the texts in the Title and Description fields. Up to 10 experts at the top relevant will be recommended.

Auto-assignment for ticket handling

The automatic assignment for ticket handling is based on the Round Robin algorithm.

Enable business rules in Studio

The business rules for auto-assignment are disabled by default and need to be manually enabled in Studio.

  1. From the main menu, select Administration > Configuration > Studio.
  2. In the drop-down list at the top of the page, select Request or Incident as the record type and click Processes and Rules tab.
  3. On the After applying changes process event, enable the business rule to set a person as Owner. Example:

  4. In the drop-down list at the top of the page, select Group as the record type and click Processes and Rules tab.

  5. Enable the business rule to clear the cache on both the After adding relationship and After removing relationship process event. Example:

Round Robin algorithm

By applying the Round Robin algorithm, Service Management can automatically assign requests or incidents evenly among the experts. To see this, create a new request/incident or open an existing request/incident.

  • For Requests, if you leave the Owner field blank, the system will automatically assign the request to a member of the Service desk group in ascending alphabetical order based on the members' names.
  • For Incidents, if you leave the Expert Assignee field blank, the system will automatically assign the incident to a member of the Expert group in ascending alphabetical order based on the members' names.
